intro: Pentacalia sagasteguii, commonly known as the Sagastegui's pentacalia, is a flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its stems are often hairy. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
